title: Seeing Like a Network: Learning to think about digital security
description: This is an interactive workshop in digital security focused on what’s called “Threat Modeling” in the computer security world — understanding how the networks you use see you, and how to realistically defend against the most likely attacks. We’ll cover some security tools and techniques, but we’ll focused making the networked environment legible enough to let you seek out tools and techniques suited to your situation.
comment: I’d love to attend this but can’t on Friday.  Will any notes or materials be made available after the session?  Or is there any chance it could be done again later in the month?

title: Hello PhoneGap
description: The miracle of mobile computing has arrived. Exceedingly powerful computers, seamlessly networked and with a variety of in-built sensors… all right in your pocket.PhoneGap is an open source framework that lets you program cross-platform mobile phone apps using HTML, Javascript and CSS. Providing a Javascript API to access  the accelerometer, GPS, notifications, and other hardware capabilities of your phone, you can write your code once and deploy the app to Android, iPhone, Blackberry and several other platforms.

title: Intro to Makerbotting
description: Learn how to go from file to print. In this lightning session, you will learn how to calibrate a MakerBot, prepare a 3D file (STL) using MakerWare, and then print it on the machines. That’s all there is to it!
comment: I’d love to do this but will be at the PhoneGap session today, so I hope we can do this again some time.

title: UX Skill – Responsive Design Process
description: Do you create UX documents in Omnigraffle, Visio, InDesign, Axure or Illustrator?  Does the design team still create Photoshop PSD files to hand off to the developer?  That no longer works in the responsive design world we live in.
comment: Attending!  Is there going to be another session about Bootstrap, or will that be part of this session?

title: Making midi devices with the arduino micro/leonardo
description: Given the interest I have received in a working midi group I wanted to do a two hour session next satruday on making a midi device using the usb-midi capable arduinos. In this workshop we will go through the electronics of hardware midi and the logistics of making a usb midi device and then we will make midi devices using the arduino hardware. You should bring a leonardo or micro as well as a sharp pc900 (which you can order through the group order https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AhRKt6oil9H-dHZFY0prX0pmSHRIdVQ0eUVxWVZfaWc&usp=sharing) for midi in and a 5 pin din connector for each way you want to go (one for in one for out).

title: Building Websites with Twitter Bootstrap
description: Hi! This is a hands-on workshop where we are going to build a single page portfolio site with Twitter Bootstrap.
